fact: One study found that only 12% of meadow voles survive the first month, with most voles likely dying due to predation.
Male orangutans frequently force female orangutans to mate with them.
Cowbirds lay their eggs in the nests of other birds and display 'mafia' like behavior by destroying eggs or nestlings of hosts if they eject their eggs.
Dominant females commonly kill pups born to subordinates and temporarily expel subordinate females from the group during the latter months of their own pregnancy.

The common cuckoo female lays one egg is the nest of other birds and usually removes and eats one of the host’s eggs. In general, the cuckoo egg hatches before those of the host and the cuckoo chicks start evicting host offspring from the nest.
In the Brazilian ant Forelius pusillus, the nest entrance is closed at sunset. One to eight workers ﬁnish the job from the outside and, in doing so, sacriﬁce their lives.
The offspring of the desert spider eat their own mother.

animal_name: Podarcis muralis: the common wall lizard
Trichinella, Echinococcus spp., Leishmania, Sarcoptes scabiei canis, Babesia, Trichomonosis, and Haemosporida.

fact: Bottlenose dolphins have been found to kill harbor porpoises, plausibly to practice their infanticide skills or to maintain their fighting skills.
Intergroup aggression, including lethal attacks, is a pervasive feature of chimpanzee societies.
Both male and female chimpanzees kill infants.
During their pregnancy, the most developed embryo will feed on its siblings.
In Namibia, kelp gull pluck out the eyes of juvenile Cape fur seals and then later feast on its carcass.
The Northern short-tailed shrew has venomous saliva that it uses to immobilize some of its prey to eat it later.
